ci_support_linux_64_mpinompipython3.10._:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
fortran_compiler:
- gfortran
fortran_compiler_version:
- '14'
libboost_devel:
- '1.88'
libxml2_devel:
- '2.14'
metis:
- 5.1.0
mpi:
- nompi
mpich:
- '4'
mumps_mpi:
- 5.8.1
mumps_seq:
- 5.8.1
numpy:
- '2'
openmpi:
- '5'
petsc:
- '3.24'
petsc4py:
- '3.24'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
python_impl:
- cpython
scotch:
- 7.0.10
slepc:
- '3.24'
slepc4py:
- '3.24'
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version
  - fortran_compiler_version
zlib:
- '1'

about.description: Code_Aster offers a full range of multiphysical analysis and modelling methods that go well beyond the standard functions of a thermomechanical calculation code: from seismic analysis to porous media via acoustics, fatigue, stochastic dynamics, etc..
about.license: GPL-3.0-only AND CECILL-C AND Apache-2.0 AND LGPL-3.0-only
about.license_family: GPL-3.0-only AND CECILL-C AND Apache-2.0 AND LGPL-3.0-only

about.description: Code_Aster offers a full range of multiphysical analysis and modelling methods that go well beyond the standard functions of a thermomechanical calculation code: from seismic analysis to porous media via acoustics, fatigue, stochastic dynamics, etc..
about.license: GPL-3.0-only AND CECILL-C AND Apache-2.0 AND LGPL-3.0-only
about.license_family: GPL-3.0-only AND CECILL-C AND Apache-2.0 AND LGPL-3.0-only

name: code-aster
raw_meta_yaml:
schema_version: 1

context:
  name: code-aster
  version: "18.0.3"
  sha256: cb4b440ddeadb33677cfc53ab735a70982207eda01f762e08d2edcc0d96b2ff8
  build_base: 1
  mpi_num: ${{ 100 if mpi == 'nompi' else 0 }}
  build: 1
  mpi_prefix: ${{ mpi or 'nompi' }}

package:
  name: ${{ name|lower }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  - url: https://gitlab.com/codeaster/src/-/archive/${{ version }}/src-${{ version }}.tar.gz
    sha256: ${{ sha256 }}
    patches:
      - patches/make_shared_use_env_FC_fallback.patch
  # Modified version of Metis changing integer sizes for indexes (IDXTYPEWIDTH 64) and including headers for direct linking to Aster
  # Modified version of Mumps changing integer, complex and real sizes to four bytes (fortran kind=4), waf configuration and metis renumbering
  - url: https://www.code-aster.org/FICHIERS/prerequisites/codeaster-prerequisites-20221225-oss.tar.gz
    sha256: 40243be37c647c6df05437d5baadd4522b9cab5de97a76e1d1fb79d1645dd5fc
    target_directory: codeaster-prerequisites/

build:
  number: 1
  skip: osx or win or (python_impl == 'pypy')
  string: py${{ python | version_to_buildstring }}_${{ mpi_prefix }}_h${{ hash }}_${{ build }}
  prefix_detection:
    ignore_binary_files: true
  dynamic_linking:
    rpaths:
      - lib/
      - lib/aster/
      - if: mpi != "nompi"
        then: lib/petsc4py/lib
    missing_dso_allowlist:
      - if: linux
        then:
          - "*/libbibfor.so"
          - "*/libbibfor_ext.so"
          - "*/libbibc.so"
          - "*/libbibcxx.so"
          - "*/libAsterGC.so"
          - lib64/aster/libaster.so

requirements:
  build:
    - ${{ compiler('c') }}
    - ${{ stdlib('c') }}
    - ${{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - ${{ compiler('fortran') }}
    - if: linux
      then: libgomp
    - cmake <4
    - setuptools
    - bison
    - flex
    - swig 4.2.1.*
    - waf ==2.1.5
    - if: "mpi != 'nompi'"
      then: ${{ mpi }}
  host:
    - python
    - numpy
    - libboost-devel
    - libblas >=3.9.0
    - liblapack >=3.9.0
    - libxml2-devel
    - openblas >=0.3.20
    - zlib
    - scotch
    - mfront
    - mgis
    - miss3d
    - metis
    - hdf5 >=1.14 *${{ mpi }}*
    - libmed * *${{ mpi }}*
    - medcoupling * *${{ mpi }}*
    - scipy
    - mumps-include
    - if: (mpi == 'nompi') and not win
      then:
        - mumps-seq
    - if: (mpi != 'nompi') and not win
      then:
        - ${{ mpi }}
        - scalapack >=2.2.0,<3
        - mumps-mpi
        - parmetis
        - petsc
        - slepc
        - mpi4py
        - petsc4py
        - slepc4py
  run:
    - ${{ pin_compatible('mgis', upper_bound='x.x') }}
    - ${{ pin_compatible('mfront', upper_bound='x.x.x') }}
    - ${{ pin_compatible('miss3d', upper_bound='x.x') }}
    - ${{ pin_compatible('medcoupling', upper_bound='x.x') }}
    - ${{ pin_compatible('libmed', upper_bound='x.x') }}
    - ${{ pin_compatible('numpy', upper_bound='x.x') }}
    - libopenblas
    - libxml2-devel
    - python
    - libxcrypt
    - scipy
    - if: (mpi != 'nompi') and not win
      then:
        - petsc4py
  run_exports:
    - ${{ pin_subpackage('code-aster', upper_bound='x.x') }}

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
        - code_aster
        - medcoupling
  - requirements:
      run:
        - ${{ compiler('fortran') }}
        - cmake
    script:
      # This would run ALL sequential (currently passing 99%). Few failures due to missing xmgrace
      #- run_ctest --resutest=${{ env.get("OUTPUT_DIR", default="temp/seq") }}/${{ mpi }} -L submit ${{ '-L sequential' if mpi == 'nompi' else '' }} -LE need_data --timefactor=10.0 --only-failed-results --clean
      - run_ctest -R 'forma01a|sslp114a|mumps05a|mumps01a|umat001a|zzzz121a' --resutest=${{ env.get("OUTPUT_DIR", default="temp/seq") }}/${{ mpi }} --clean

about:
  license: GPL-3.0-only AND CECILL-C AND Apache-2.0 AND LGPL-3.0-only
  license_file:
    - dep-licenses/
  summary: "Code_Aster : a finite element solver"
  description: |
    Code_Aster offers a full range of multiphysical analysis and modelling methods that go well beyond the standard functions of a thermomechanical calculation code: from seismic analysis to porous media via acoustics, fatigue, stochastic dynamics, etc..
  homepage: https://www.code-aster.org
  repository: https://gitlab.com/codeaster/
  documentation: https://www.code-aster.org/V2/doc/default/en/index.php?man=commande

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - Krande
    - ldallolio
